explosives.rationale: Not classified because of the oxygen balance calculated at -210.5, lower than -200 of the criteria, though containing nitrogen atoms adjacent to each other as chemical groups associated with explosive properties present.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains nitrogen atoms adjacent to each other as chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties present

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test suitable for the solid with a melting point of 140 degC or less has not been established. (87.8 - 88.2 degC melting points)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and chlorine (but not fluorine) and the oxygen and chlorine are chemically bonded only to carbon.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available (Melting point: 87.8 to 88.2degC)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: In the 3 tests with rats, we compared the LD50 values for male and female and selected the lower value of these groups. Then based on the calculated LD50 = 77.2mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), the substance was classified as Category 3.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as the outside of Category based on the description (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data) that death is not observed in administration at 2000mg/kg (male) and 3000mg/kg (female) in rats.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The value of the lower one was adopted among LC50 values of a male and females. And it was set as category 4 based on LC50 = 1.50mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as category 3 based on the statement (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data) that erythema was seen until 48 hours after setting to the rabbit, but it is very slight, and it was disappeared 72 hours afterward.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although the irritant effect was obserbed in the iris after one hour, it disappeared after 24 hours. And although redness and edema were observed in the conjunctiva, it disappeared after 14 days. Based on these results (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), it was classified into Category 2A.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the statement (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data) with negativity by the Maximization method of a guinea pig, it carried out the outside of Category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is no multi generation epidemiology, multi generations mutagenicity tests, data from germ cell mutagenicity test, and there is the description that it is negative in the somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity test (in vivo small core test using the red blood cells of mouse) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data). So it is classified as the out of the Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: By the carcinogenicity test in rat and mouse, based on the description that carcinogenicity was not observed (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), it was out of the Category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In the reproduction toxicity study using a rat, abnormal labor (hard labor, delay delivery), extention of the gestational age, and decline in a a delivery rate and birthrate were found for the parental animals by the dose of general toxicity, and the influence of growth on a child animal, reduction of the number of delivery survival children, decrease of perinatal and the four-day probability of survival and delay of a righting reflective formation day were acknowledged. Although teratogenicity was not seen by the dose which indicates general toxicity to parental animals by the teratogenicity study using a rat, low values of fetal body weight and metacarpal bone ossification delayed were seen (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data). It was set as Category 2 based on the above information.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was considered as Category 1(systemic) based on the description (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data )that abdominal position, side-lying position, round back position, the fall of spontaneous movement, walk malfunction, irregular breath or dyspnea, diarrhea, and contamination of an abdomen part, loss of activity and hypothermia were observed in the rat and the mouse at dose within the range of guidance value in Category 1 (dosage near LD50 value).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, pancreas, genitalia) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (heart)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In rats with administration (4.78mg/kg or 9.33mg/kg) within the guidance value limits of Category 1, there is a mention of effects such as decrease leucocyte numbers, elevation of glucose, suppressed of total protein and albumin; elevation of gamma GT and urea nitrogens; suppressed of triglycerides; hepatocellular hypertrophy; hypertrophy of pancreas acinar cells; hypersecretion of harderian glands; increase of mesenteric lymph nodes mast cells; nypertrophy of submandibular acinar cells; miniaturization of seminal vesicles and prostate glands; miniaturization of ovaries, uterus, and vaginae; atrophy of ovaries and uteri; low values of ovarian weight. Moreover, in mice with administration (15.9mg/kg or 46.2mg/kg) within the guidance value limits of Category 2, there is a mention of decrease weight gain, decreased food consumption, elevation of GOT, increase of heart relative weight, and increase of liver relative weight (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data). Based on the above information, it was classified into Category 1 (liver, pancreas, genitalia) and Category 2 (heart).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was suggested from 72-hour ErC50>0.76 mg/L of algae (Green algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data) that relevant toxicity is not indicated in the water solubility (0.087mg/L (an Agricultural Chemicals abstracts, 2004)) of this substance, it considered as the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: May cause long lasting harmful effects to aquatic life
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 4, since rapid degradability is unknown, bioaccumulative (log Kow=5.61 (Agrichemical Abstracts, 2004)), though water-insolubule and no acute toxicity is reported within the saturated aqueous solution.
